the light of increased understanding from comparative studies of the genetics
and development of a wide variety of organisms.
The computational argument occurs in a variety of forms in current in-
telligent design literature, sometimes with relatively simple calculations of
infinitesimal probabilities, on other occasions with much more technical
specification of conditions under which we should make the “design infer-
ence”  and  conclude  that  some  aspect  of  life  has  been  intelligently
